subject: Re: How to write a Mock Class for a 3rd party class where the contructor are private
msgSnippet: Hi, Virtual Mock Objects can overcome this problem without the need for facades, wrappers, or interfaces. Here s some links: -
messageBody:
Hi,

"Virtual Mock Objects" can overcome this problem without the need for
facades, wrappers, or interfaces.

Here's some links:

- http://www.xprogramming.com/xpmag/virtualMockObjects.htm

- http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/java/library/j-aspectj2/

- http://blogs.codehaus.org/people/vmassol/archives/000138.html


There will soon be frameworks which make it easy to use virtual mock
objects. For more info, email me offline at:

virtualmock AT thewoolleyweb DOT com

Thanks,
Chad
